Answer: You don’t need to.Before the like-minded people, there was, there is you.The only reason a person looks for like-minded people is because there’s something they want to do or something they’re doing that they believeWhen you believe in your mission, your calling, your destiny, you set out to accomplish it despite who goes with you—like-minded people are not required. Success is reaching the goal. That’s the disciplineYou don’t need to.Before the like-minded people, there was, there is you.The only reason a person looks for like-minded people is because there’s something they want to do or something they’re doing that they believeWhen you believe in your mission, your calling, your destiny, you set out to accomplish it despite who goes with you—like-minded people are not required. Success is reaching the goal. That’s the discipline.When you approach life like this, something extraordinary happens. The very people you think you want to find will find you on your path getting the work in, but only if you’re getting the work in. If you do this you become unique, what I believe the universe intended you to be.I was beaten for years as a child. I didn’t care about what was happening within anyone else’s home. While some of my friends may have had similar experiences, there was no support group. No one stepped in to say, “Billy take a day off, I’ll take the beating today.” I believed that only I could solve my problem, and I did. This is the approach I take with everything from that time to this time.The most valuable thing you can do for your life is to develop the discipline to do things on your own. You’ll find that while developing that discipline the very people you’re trying to find will always find you.Until Next Time.

Answer: China’s BRI is about soft power, an ambitious attempt to help develop a very large chunk of the world that had been exploited by colonialism and western powers. But it will not be recognised as such by the West. Instead US expended every ounce of its wisdom calling it a debt trap and trying to convince the affected countries to stay away from it. By and large unsuccessful, as many see it as an opportunity to escape from the poverty trap. Almost 100 countries have signed up, including many from S.America, near neighbours of the US. Is this not ironic? But in the current, it will not be acknowleChina’s BRI is about soft power, an ambitious attempt to help develop a very large chunk of the world that had been exploited by colonialism and western powers. But it will not be recognised as such by the West. Instead US expended every ounce of its wisdom calling it a debt trap and trying to convince the affected countries to stay away from it. By and large unsuccessful, as many see it as an opportunity to escape from the poverty trap. Almost 100 countries have signed up, including many from S.America, near neighbours of the US. Is this not ironic? But in the current, it will not be acknowledged as soft power, because the US and UK controlled media will not allow its recognition, and will continue to bad-mouth it, no matter what.China sees trade and investment to be the means to win and influence friends. It recognizes that its political system based on a mix of Confucianism, Chinese culture and tradition, and modernity, is not suitable for every country and made no attempt to export it. It does try to encourage the learning of the Chinese language, setting up some Confucian Institutes. Quite a difficult task as Chinese is a difficult language. Such seemingly harmless institutes are being eliminated by the US government. Even the contributions it made to universities are seen to be a national security threat.Chinese culture is also quite unique. Especially as the world since WW2 is flooded with western cultures, especially American movies, songs, fashionwear, and much else. Not an exaggeration to say that consciously or unconsciously, our lifestyle copies that of the Americans, from Coke to Hollywood. And at the intellectual level, many in the world crave for an American university education. Such is the strength of American institutions, media, and propaganda, juxtaposed on the widespread use of the English language. Despite all the grief that may be attributed to the current administration, US influence is still strong, influential, and widespread.I am not sure Japan can make much boast of soft power. It too has the problem of culture and language. But it does not suffer the wrath of the English language media. And it does not mind playing the second fiddle, hanging on the American coat-tail. So from time to time it receives some praise, sometime sincere, sometime to patronise it. Universally speaking, it cannot be said to have much influence, sans sushi and sashimi. Japanese movies and TV serials are less well known than Korean’s.

question: https://www.quora.com/If-Japan-was-fully-independent-today-not-under-control-of-the-US-and-fully-engaged-itself-in-development-of-military-technology-industries-and-capabilities-how-powerful-would-they-be

Answer: Troops of Japan Grand Self-Defense Force (JGSDF) 1st Airborne Brigade march during an inspection parade for the JGSDF Eastern Army 44th anniversary celebration at Asaka training field, suburban Tokyo.World War II ended when the Empire of Japan surrendered unconditionally to the United States. The U.S. then took control of Japan and drafted its Constitution. Article 9 of that Constitution states that “the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation.” This clause outlaws Japan from maintaining “land, sea and air forces, as well as other war potential.” The arrangementTroops of Japan Grand Self-Defense Force (JGSDF) 1st Airborne Brigade march during an inspection parade for the JGSDF Eastern Army 44th anniversary celebration at Asaka training field, suburban Tokyo.World War II ended when the Empire of Japan surrendered unconditionally to the United States. The U.S. then took control of Japan and drafted its Constitution. Article 9 of that Constitution states that “the Japanese people forever renounce war as a sovereign right of the nation.” This clause outlaws Japan from maintaining “land, sea and air forces, as well as other war potential.” The arrangement means the U.S. must provide for Japan’s defense. Under the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security, America is obligated to station U.S. forces within Japan’s borders and potential conflict zones.But the Japanese reinterpreted Article 9, America agreed, and have been building their own military and are becoming more comfortable with it. In 2015, 71 percent of Japanese said that they were happy with the size and scope of Japan’s Self-Defense Forces. With the U.S. slowly backing away from its defense commitments, China increasingly becoming more belligerent toward its neighbors, and an unstable North Korea in possession of nuclear weapons that could raze Japan, the Japanese are seriously looking to build up their military once again to counter these threats.Thus, yes, Japan has built up her military, but in keeping with the concept of “non-aggression.” It is true that China, which suffered terribly under WWII Japanese aggression, has condemned any remilitarization. This said, Japan is a close American ally; there has been NO American interference with Japan. The U.S. integrates its military with their Japanese counterpart in military exercises, with an eye to Chinese military expansion in Eastern Pacific waters. They sell arms to Japan. The United States, soon after the Japanese War Crimes Trials, ending in 1948, forgave Japan. Unlike with Germany, the U.S. never went after the many war criminals who escaped the net of immediate American wrath post-war. America will not curb any growth in Japanese capabilities.

The really crazy part is that kids are getting suspended and people areI think its stupid.Case in point:The “Devious lick” - a trend where you go into your school’s restroom and vandalize stuff. Three days into the trend arriving at my school and north of 80% of the hand-sanitizer and paper towel dispensers are flat-out gone, an entire restroom was covered in cool-aid, a few mirrors were removed from the walls, and rumor has it that a toilet was even unbolted from the floor.Some of this stuff required serious equipment and how people managed to do it between short class changes is beyond me. The really crazy part is that kids are getting suspended and people are still doing it thinking that its funny.In other schools, fire alarms have been stolen, bathrooms flooded, sinks removed, and cops called to the school to take kids away in handcuffs… all in the name of likes and views.I understand why some people like Tiktok and that it can be a great app if you curate your feed well, but this one app is continually at the center of complete stupidity like this.Thanks for reading and don’t be stupid everyone.
